content:
Here are 10 trendy and new restaurants in Brooklyn that are worth checking out:

1. Olmsted (Prospect Heights) - Seasonal American cuisine with a focus on locally sourced ingredients and creative presentation.
2. Win Son Bakery (East Williamsburg) - Taiwanese-American bakery serving up unique pastries, sandwiches, and coffee.
3. Llama Inn (Williamsburg) - Peruvian-inspired dishes with a modern twist, including ceviches, grilled meats, and inventive cocktails.
4. Di An Di (Greenpoint) - Vietnamese restaurant with a focus on fresh, vibrant flavors and an impressive cocktail program.
5. Faun (Prospect Heights) - Rustic Italian cuisine with a focus on seasonal, locally sourced ingredients and house-made pastas.
6. Ops Pizza (Bushwick) - Wood-fired Neapolitan-style pizzas made with natural sourdough and topped with locally sourced ingredients.
7. Misi (Williamsburg) - Modern Italian cuisine with a focus on handmade pastas and seasonal vegetables.
8. Maison Yaki (Prospect Heights) - French-Japanese fusion restaurant with a focus on grilled skewers and small plates.
9. Gertie (Williamsburg) - Modern Jewish deli serving up classic dishes with a twist, along with house-made pastries and coffee.
10. Oxalis (Prospect Heights) - Contemporary French cuisine with a focus on seasonal, locally sourced ingredients and a rotating tasting menu.
